scripts.say: Kill confirmed! None may stand before the might of the Northern Parliament!
I'll beat you all to a pulp!
We'll kick out anything that trespasses upon our home, vermin or Siren...!
Haha! What do you think, Commander? Pretty good coordination on the fly, right?
Remarkably, despite not having a determined command structure, the members of the Northern Parliament all fought on the same page, as if linked by their strong sense of unity.
I know you like what you see, but it's best not to stare too much, Commander~
I felt a warm breath tickle my ear. Chapayev had snuck up behind me.
Here's the report on the current status of our positioning, supplies, and damages. Please look it over before everyone gets back.
Whether you choose to attack the Siren stronghold or rejoin with the Eagle Union forces, we'll likely encounter more enemies.
So, what will your orders be, Commander? I'll do anything you say~
What we should do now is...

options.content: Join up with the Eagle Union fleet.

scripts.say: I'm worried about my friends. But, now that our communications have been disrupted by the Mirror Sea, what should we do next...
This is solely based upon anecdotal evidence, but we believe that the "nucleus" must be destroyed in order to escape from the influence of the Mirror Sea.
From the information we've been able to analyze, we believe that then nucleus is located within the Siren stronghold.
In other words, it is necessary for us to capture the Siren stronghold in order to achieve your goal - and perhaps the Eagle Union has realized that as well.
дa. It is very likely that the Eagle Union is also en route to the stronghold.
Of course they are! Where else would they be headed to in this Mirror Sea?
Aha! I get it! If we just capture the stronghold, all we have to do is wait for the others to show up!
You mixed up our objectives, but... that thought process isn't wrong.
Wouldn't it be better to focus our attention on the common objective instead of expending valuable time and resources searching around blindly?
It's decided then. I'll be counting on you~
Let's trust our friends' judgment.
